The project validation page allows you to view or change the validation settings for a project. A validator is a tool that checks that resources conform to a specification, DTD, or some other set of rules.
Each validator can apply to certain types of files, certain project natures, and certain project facets. When a validator applies to a project facet or nature, the workbench uses that validator only on projects that have that facet or nature. Likewise, most validators apply only to certain types of files, so the workbench uses those validators only on those types of files.
Select the Override validation preferences check box. Select this check box if you want to override the default validation preferences set in the workbench Preferences page. If the Override validation preferences check box is not enabled, go to Window > Preferences > Validation and select the Allow projects to override these preference settings check box.
Select the Run validation when you manually build check box if you want the selected validators to run whenever you build your project. To enable the Run validation when you manually build check box, select at least one validator in the list.
Select the Run validation automatically when you save changes to resources check box if you want the selected validators to automatically run whenever you save changes to your project resources. To enable the Run validation automatically when you save changes to resources check box, select at least one validator in the list.
Use the Maximum number of validation messages field to define the maximum allowable validation messages for the project. If the number of validation messages reported in the task list exceeds the number set in this field, validation will terminate.
